thread.section_title: Buying Business Travel | For Business, Corporate Travel & Meeting Buyers & Arrangers
thread.title: Norwegian reports passenger traffic boost

title: Norwegian reports passenger traffic boost
text:
0 comments Tom Newcombe Mon, 6 Jul 2015 09:58 Follow @thomasnewcombe Norwegian has reported a growth in passenger numbers for June, compared to the same period in 2014.
The airline carried 2.4 million people last month, an increase of 7 per cent.
Norwegian also reported a record load factor of 88 per cent last month, up from 5.5 per cent in June last year.
Norwegian CEO Bjørn Kjos said: “I’m pleased that so many choose to travel with Norwegian and that we can fill almost nine out of ten seats.
“We’re particularly happy with the development in our long-haul operation. At the same time, the weather has been in our favour as many Scandinavians have escaped the cold weather during the month of June.”
Last month, Norwegian announced it was doubling the number of flights it operates between Gatwick and Gothenburg for the winter 2015/16 season.
